member.name: T:Narumikazuchi.Generators.ByteSerialization.ByteSerializer
member.summary: Provides methods to serialize runtime objects into and from [] arrays or streams.
member.remarks: The currently only supports the serialization of public mutable members, which means public non-readonly fields and public properties with a getter and setter or initilizer.

member.name: M:Narumikazuchi.Generators.ByteSerialization.ByteSerializer.GetExpectedSerializedSize``1(``0)
member.summary: Calculates the expected size of the [] array after serialization of the sepcified runtime object.
member.param: The runtime object to calculate the expected size of.
member.returns: The expected size of the [] array after serialization.
member.remarks: This should NOT throw an exception however if it still does, then it indicates a problem with the code generation. If you encounter an exception it would help if you could contact me for a timely fix.

member.summary: Represents the serialized layout of data.

member.summary: Data will be serialized in the order the properties/fields appear in the type declaration.

member.summary: Data will be serialized in the order specified by the .

member.summary: Data will be serialized in the default order.

member.name: T:Narumikazuchi.Generators.ByteSerialization.SerializeDefaultAttribute`1
member.summary: Tells the generator to use the supplied default value for this parameter, when using the constructor for initializing the object during deserialization.

member.name: M:Narumikazuchi.Generators.ByteSerialization.SerializeDefaultAttribute`1.#ctor(`0)
member.summary: Tells the generator to use the supplied default value for this parameter, when using the constructor for initializing the object during deserialization.
member.param: The default value to always use for the constructor parameter.

member.name: T:Narumikazuchi.Generators.ByteSerialization.SerializeFromMemberAttribute
member.summary: Tells the code generator, which field or property from the serialization process represents this parameter value in the constructor.
member.remarks: Use followed by the field- or property-name to specify the member to use. You can also use a raw for this, but is more robust and therefore recommended.

member.name: M:Narumikazuchi.Generators.ByteSerialization.SerializeFromMemberAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Tells the code generator, which field or property from the serialization process represents this parameter value in the constructor.
member.param: The name of the field or property to map to the constructor parameter.
member.remarks: Use followed by the field- or property-name to specify the member to use. You can also use a raw for this, but is more robust and therefore recommended.
